title: Makes retirement home bingo seem like an adrenaline rush.
body: I really have no idea where to begin on this "game." Destiny fails on so many levels, one star seems generous.  So, let's start with the story.  There is no story!  Mario for the Nintendo was more emotionally involving than the Destiny campaign.  The game play is so repetitive an unrewarding that it will make retirement home bingo seem like an adrenaline rush.  The multiplayer is the least exciting experience I have yet to play from any game.  Most game modes will be 3vs3 to a maximum of 6v6.  Are you kidding me?  We have games like battlefield supporting 64 players but destiny only gives you a maximum of 12.The loot system is trash.  Your first 20 character levels are based off an experience point system.  After that, you are at the mercy of the game to bless you with high level drops which is the only way to get above level 20.  Be ready to literally run in circles for HOURS trying to be blessed with a drop that will most likely turn into an item for a different class than your own.My advice, avoid this game.

title: Save your money not a good game anymore.
body: I would not recommend currently buying this game. It used to be good but bungie has switched to a pay to win model. They have also abandoned content and moved tward pvp turnaments. I have put over 800 hours into the game and I'm sad to say bungies new direction is disappointing.

title: Addicting
body: This game will keep you playing every chance you get. Although it doesn't have a particularly long story, it is fun especially with friends. It does have it negative aspects. The short story for one. The game developer compensates for it by allowing you to go online and explore pieces of history you find while playing. The game has repetitive missions you do in order to level up. It's not terrible for anyone who has dealt with grinding in other games. Lastly, until you reach level 25 (capped at level 32 when you purchase the expansion) you will not feel like you're getting anywhere. Once you do you will find yourself playing every chance you get. Even just to play one strike mission before work. With a game this addicting I can see past the few flaws. It's definitely worth five stars.

Now, onto my main gripe...there's very little to do, it seems, and almost no story to go on...my review is short, but that's my take.

title: One of the worst games I have ever played
body: One of the worst games I have ever played.  Period.  It's nothing more than a DLC money grab.  Like one of those "free to play" MMO's that isn't worth playing unless you dish out money for in-game add-ons.  The "campaign" or "story" mode, whatever you want to call it, is ok until your character levels up to 20, then it just ends?? Unless you buy DLC, of course.  And there's no storyline at all.  Your character gets resurrected from an ancient car wreck at the beginning of the game, and then you're thrust into this war against "The Darkness."  No explanation, no back story, nothing.  And then we have (sigh) multi player.  The higher ranked players always have the more powerful weapons, so they always win.  And 90% of the time you're killed by someone camping with a rocket launcher or overpowered shotgun.  As a serious Halo player, I'm very disappointed in Bungie's feeble attempt to compete with Halo since moving on.  Now before the trolls rip me apart and I get a bunch of insulting responses, just remember there's a lot of people out there that will agree with me.

title: An average game that manages to be a lot of fun...for awhile
body: I've noticed so far that a lot of the reviews for this game are either love it or hate it.  I find myself somewhere in the middle on this one.  I wan't to love it, but I just can't ignore the shortfalls.  That said I'm enjoying the game a great deal for what it is.    Let's start with Graphics:  Personaly I think they are actually really good.  I'm not really a graphics nerd though.  If a game looks good to me I don't spend a lot of time analysing them.    Music:  I've found myself at several moments in the game thinking that the music just didn't fit what was going on.  It's not a bad soundtrack, it just dosen't seem to fit real well to me, but at the same time I don't find it detracts from the game in any way.    Gameplay:  This is what makes or breaks a game for me, and in Destiny I honestly find it a bit of a mixed bag.  The firefights are fun and for the most part well done.  However, they get to be a bit repetative.  It seems that each mission is a bit more of the same.  Run from point A to point B, kill everything in between and then defend your ghost as he acesses some ancient computer.  I feel they could have used a bit more imagination to add some variety to the missions.  Especially since you are pretty much forced to repeat missions as you level.    Online Interactions:  This is where I feel they really could have done a better job.  There are lots of other players running around in the world beside me and other than to wave or dance with them I have no way of communicating with them.  In my opinion this seriously hurts the multiplayer aspect of the game.  An optional proximity chat would have been nice.    Story:  In my original review I didn't touch on the Story so I'm editing this to add some quick thoughts pertaining to this.  Honestly I'm now approaching level 20 and I'm not even real sure what the story is.  It's mostly told in little blurbs from your companion ghost.  There are however a few cutscenes there are actually fairly well done.  In my opinion these cutscenes show off what the story could have been.  The voice acting in them is decent, and there is even a bit of humor thrown in.  Most importantly your character actually has a voice in these cutscenes.  I would have loved to see them add a lot more of these scenes even if just short ones.  They help you care about the story and your character.  Unfortunately, they are few and far between and it leaves you not really feeling pulled into the universe and the story of the game.  Of all my complaints this is probably the biggest and most disapointing aspect of the game for me.  I really wanted a great story to lose myself in during the many hours I'd be spending in this universe.  I wanted to care about my Character and his fight.  Unfortunately I'm not even really sure what that fight is for.    Now all that said, the simple fact is that I'm actually having a lot of fun playing the game.  I find myself drawn back to it as I'm sitting here now wishing I could be at home playing it.  So the game isn't a bad game at all.  I don't know how long the fun will last as I'm already level 16 and the soft level cap is 20.  I'm not sure if I'll find myself drawn in enough to want to try and grind out the gear needed to attempt the endgame raid.  I honestly hope I am.    I won't comment on the multiplayer PVP aspect of the game since I have no interest in it and won't touch it.    Edit (9/23/14): Ok so its been two weeks.  I've managed to get a Hunter to level 26 and a Warlock to 22.  I have spent close to 100hrs playing this game to this point.  I would say I had fun for the first 40-50hrs and then it just became one big repetative grindfest.  When the best way to get gear in a game is to stand in front of a cave shooting at anything that pops it's head out for hours on end.. well that game has serious issues.  Destiny without a doubt is a game full of issues.  I am as of today no longer playing it and will be trading it in next week for Forza Horizon or Shadow ofMordor.  I spent more hours than I should have with this game hoping to find that it would get better.  It don't.  I haven't done the raid and wouldn't ever have a chance to without having five other friends playing the game.  Most of my friends quit after they beat the story and realized the amount of time and dedication it would take to gear up thier toon further.  Anyway, at this point I can't recomend this game to anyone but the hardcore player who has literally unlimited time to thow away grinding.
